Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vivzkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and I will definitely recommend. The location is perfect! It's walking distance to Spanish Steps - one of the landmark in Rome. It's also located in the Central area where you can just walk along and pass by to the shopping area, name all the brands - LV, Channel, Prada, Gucci etc etc. and most of all - the owner and staffs are very friendly. During our stay until we check out . One of the staff even carried our luggages all the way to the taxi stand. All worth your money, rooms are clean and bathroom is spacious. .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place, perfect atention for a budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Belen_Chile
Reviews.Content: One close friend stayed at this hotel one time, she liked and came back with her mom...and after that she recommended me to go too. So i trusted in her and NOT in Tripadvisor bad comments. And i DID THE RIGHT THING because i loved this hotel! LOCATION is perfect! and reason to come back if i have the lucky to go to Rome again!. I walked to the corso road for shopping, spanish steps, to the vatican, fontana di trevi, piazza Navona...it was so central that i could get to everywhere walking!! I went last July 2010 with my mom and stayed 3 nights at the superior doble room and it was perfect! The entrance can be scary when you arrive for the first time, the lift is noisy etc but when you get to the 2nd floor where is the hotel everything changes! The owner is fantastic, a super nice italian girl that gives you all kind of tips (even the close you must use to enter to churches), breakfast includes croissants =) fruit. I stayed at the superior doble standard room and i recommend it as the price is really good. The rooms are just right to sleep, plasma tv and a simple bathroom-- Again :) great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClancyMontana
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not look like the pictures shown online. We had to climb 2 steep flights of stairs (elevator not in order), were led down hall and some stairs which we had to "duck" to clear the low archway which led us to room #15, marked by masking tape on the door. Mop, bucket, vacuum, etc. outside of room. 4 beds in room (requested one queen or king), cramped, light fixtures did not work and outlets coming out of wall, missing light bulbs, bathroom with missing tiles everywhere, toilet positioned by sink and had to "sit" facing doorway, stunk of sewer + exhaust from cars in alley below window. No air conditioning. My husband had just had his wallet stolen on the subway and after an entire day at the police station and US Embassy cancelling credit cards, getting a new passport, etc., were stuck with this hotel. Explained we wanted to leave and try to fly back early, but were forced by front desk staff to pay for 2 nights, even though we only stayed one night. I wrote them 5-6 times after returning to the USA and requested our 2nd night fee refunded and received a very curt letter stating they MIGHT be able to give us credit for another night stay. We will never stay here again and do not recommend anyone else stay here. Bad coffee, melba toast and yogurt for "breakfast". Rude staff. kdm

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cefalu2009
Reviews.Content: Our room at Hotel Marcus was absolutely terrible. The lights did not work properly, the shower tiles were broken, the bathroom smelled like a sewer, and the door that led to the balcony, which was shared by other guests, was broken and would not lock. Some strange noise from the air conditioning unit would routinely kick on at night, which disrupted our sleep. Even though the location is excellent, I would absolutely NOT stay at the Hotel Marcus again. The hotel manager was not very friendly, and he actually tried to charge us an additional 100 euros for our prepaid room. This was the worst hotel experience of our lives, and we will not return to Hotel Marcus when we travel to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Aurora and Location”
Reviews.Author: wallacecorbo
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the hotel you'll probably get the feeling that you just got punk'd. The hotel is actually at the second floor of a really old building. I mean, really old. So it's uphills from there. The hotel itself looks really good and if you don't arrive too late (or too early) you'll probably get to know Aurora. Aurora is the receptionist that stays there most of the time and if there's good things to be said about the place, it's all because of her. She will talk to you, help you with any problems you may have at the hotel and even help you with your trip, if you have doubts as to where to go and other things. So, after you meet Aurora you go to the rooms. If you've booked a superior room, you'll probably get to one that looks really good, is not too big, but will give you plenty of confort. If you've booked a standard room, you'll have to go downstairs (and look out for your head, cause the ceiling is really low and i've hit my head there like 5 times") and you'll see a room that is neither too big or too small, but definitely looks old. My experience with the rooms were not without problem. Both rooms we've booked (my family and I) had the same problem: the shower leaked through the wall, which ended up wetting the floor and giving the room a strong smell of mold. So we decided to talk to Aurora and the immediately changed our rooms to other ones that had no problems (and she also called the plumber, so the rooms are probably fixed by now). The Wi-Fi will work inside the rooms (it worked inside mine, at least) and the breakfast is good - nothing special to it, you may just as well buy something at the supermarket that is really close to the hotel or eat somewhere else. And as far as location goes, this is probably one of the best hotel you can get in rome. Is very central, close to everything, so you won't have to worry about taxis, buses or anything, cause there won't be a huge amount of walking to do to get to anywhere. And if you intend to do some shopping in Rome, it is really close to Via del Corso (one of the main shopping streets) and not a lot of walking to get to the other 2 shopping streets which I forgot the names.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Amenities, BEST location”
Reviews.Author: Cella65
Reviews.Content: Quiet, Comfy, Cozy hotel. Yes, the room was small, but who goes to the center of Rome to hang out int he hotel. Perfect location and the price is right. Would definately stay again in the future. Hotel staff could share basic information, but gave us all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the website”
Reviews.Author: chris60922
Reviews.Content: I booked through the website of Hotel 939. Do not be tricked by this website. When I arrived, they did not have any renovated rooms available and we were given room 13. It was dark, dank, and so very small. There was no room for our luggage, the toilet ran, and the shower leaked. But the location was really great, so we just stayed away all day long and only slept there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bchrist12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, Oct 8 to 12, 2010. The hotel has been totally renovated since some of the earlier reviews. Rooms/bathrooms were very clean, small compared to N.America (but average by European Standards). The beds are a little stiff, some sort of foam mattress but overall comfortable. AC worked great, still needed in October. No safe in room, despite being advertised. Staff speaks english well. Breakfast (depending on who you book through it may or may not be included) pretty simple, croissant, bun, and coffee, but a great way to get a quick start in the morning. Sorry, forgot to take pictures of the inside. New windows help keep out the street noise. Weekend was a little noisy but not enough to keep you up. Free wireless Internet, signal was pretty low but only cut out once during our stay. Staff is at the front desk 24/7. Location, Location Location. If you look down the street from the front door you can see the Spanish Steps. 5 min walk to the Pantheon 5 min walk to Piazza Navona/Campo di Fiori 15 min or less walk to the Colosseum/Forum 15 min or less walk to the Vatican/St.Peters

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location. The best for this price!”
Reviews.Author: MagdaG1984
Reviews.Content: It was our extra fast honeymoon trip and to be honest, I was afraid of what will we see after arriving in Rome, mainly because of the terrible reviews some travelers have posted. We were actually very surprised!!! I did upgrade the room from the standard one and I think it was a good decision. The room was still very tiny, but just enough for the two of us. Air conditioning worked great (we had record high temperatueres!!!), the room was renovated, clean and comfortable.; same to the bathroom. If you want to complain you will find something to talk about, BUT for this price and this location, you will not find a better hotel! If you are on a budged, do not want to stay near Termini, want to be close to everything, and you don't care about luxury, then you will be satisfied!!! You will find here everything you need. If you want luxury and elegance go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “small but right for the price”
Reviews.Author: tiffypooh
Reviews.Content: the room was small, and the bathroom even smaller but the ac worked well, it was clean en very well placed. if you are only there to sleep, it s a good place for the price. don t expect too much and you ll be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “It is tooo expencive”
Reviews.Author: PederH
Reviews.Content: You really should be looking for something else... it's too expencive, for what is returned.... Breackfast.... HA ??? dry bread.. and coffe from a maschine..

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD AND CHEAP”
Reviews.Author: medusa1979
Reviews.Content: After reading all these messages bellow I was a bit afraid of booking it but it was so cheap and I m a person who really spends all day out eating and drinking when I m travelling. I arrived to the hotel and I ve been greeted and checked in by this lady called Aurora, she is just fantastic! She helps with tips what you should and shouldnt do, she s very caring and I think 90% of my staying in this hotel was pleasant due to her customer service. The hotel is a little bit noisy but not all the time and not every day only friday/saturday night (of course you are in Central Rome the best spot ever for a little party in the weekend). My room was spotless clean and spacious. I higly recommend this hotel fro travellers and people willing to explore Rome. The location is very safe the police is around all night. I ve been to five stars hotels before and I felt bad because of some staff arrogance, so I rather go to a warm , clean place with nice staff than going to a 5 stars spot where people shows no respect for customers! And guess what: INTERNET FREE AND FAST! any other hotel you would have to pay for internet at least 5 euros a day!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: jamesliptrot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Marcus in November 2009. It was really reasonably priced, and seemed from the map to be in great location, we arrived and I would agree with a previous reviewer that the gates don't look welcoming, but there is a very simple intercom system. We stayed in room 13, which I wouldn't describe as beautiful, or indeed spacious, but it did the job! The location was perfect, a stone's throw from anything you might want to see, we walked everywhere. The receptionist was incredibly helpful and friendly, if a little eccentric. She talked us through all the tourist attraction in detail, we were both really impressed, it was exactly what we needed. Night receptionist was grumpy, but it didn't detract from our enjoyment. We had a great time, I would recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget who wants a great location. Don't go with high expectations, if you want a massive room, in a gorgeous hotel then go somewhere else and pay the premium for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: vondahren
Reviews.Content: We were in Italy for 5 weeks .The worst place we stayed. The room was a shoe box.The window did not open and the bed.What can I say.Well a bare mattress with 2 thin sheets (No blankets or covers and none in a cupboard.) Very nice bathroom clean but as you touched the chrome fittings they fell off the wall. Shower head,door knob, toilet roll holder no effort to fix them. Computer at a desk with a lamp. Told broken .When would it be fixed?Didn't know. No safe or phone as quoted on booking form.but worst of all in description.All rooms have river views. This is a lie.and they did not care.What a shame as it had a wonderful location with very friendly people in the area.and it was safe.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: aggiezeta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a total rip off. I made very good decisions and got great rooms in other European towns, but I bombed on this one. I paid for air conditioning, there was NONE! It's not like they just didn't have it on, it was not there. I didn't think I had to ask for a shower curtain, but I guess I should have requested it in advance. The shower was designed for a curtain. The whole bathroom got wet when you took a shower (it was small) but would have been ok if not wet. We ended up going down this ladder that passed for stairs and stealing a dirty bed sheet to use, it didn't work so well. The service was just bad, it wasn't a language problem, the people there (about 4, one on duty at a time) just didnt' care. There were other things, but I am not going to complain because it might have been unique to our stay. However I can imagine similar things with other guests. Choose another hotel in this area, or save your money and book the same horrible room somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all of the negative reviews..”
Reviews.Author: DD_60
Reviews.Content: Yes... it's not the Ritz... but this hotel was very pleasant. The staff-- if you take the time to talk to them -- is very nice. Both of the young men we met were more than helpful. This is absolutely NOT a 4 or 5 star hotel, probably not even a 3 star, but it cannot be beat for its location. The bathrooms were not what Americans were used to... but what bathroom in Europe is? This is the only hotel we stayed at, in 5 countries, which had a fridge in the room (nice for storing the prosciutto and mozarella we bought for lunches.) The place was clean and yes, there is construction going on... but we didn't hang out in our room a lot so we really didn't notice it. Don't know about breakfast... we would hit the streets of Rome early and find off the beaten track bars. Go with an open attitude... for the price, it's a bargain. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but............”
Reviews.Author: erfifer
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 day stay here in June. were assured there would be a pick up at airport (we were prepared to pay) but alas no pick up! our flight had been delayed, but I did phone from Scotland to let them know and was assured there was no problem! taxi from airport did not know location, but fortunately had a good map. Staff on duty not very helpful. there were obviously large renovation works going on so no dining room but we were given a ticket for cafe across the street for drink and croissant. this was closed on Sunday but no alternative was given. I hope the renovations mean that the hotel has upgraded as the location is perfect for all the sights. would consider using again if this was so, room was clean as were bathroom fascillities,shame about the upheaval (which we were not informed about) and lack of tourist info.(night reception could tell us nothing about visits to Vatican infact it seemed to belong to another country!).

Reviews.Title: “Not somewhere to take your girlfriend for a romantic weekend...”
Reviews.Author: Brucie77
Reviews.Content: ...but, excellent location (half-way between the Spanish steps and the Piazza Navona) for a lads weekend away in a great city. The cheap price meant that we didn't care about the hotel's shoddiness. Who sits around in their hotel room all day anyway? You should be out seeing the sites and only use the room to pass out in at the end of the night. This place is basically one step up from a hostel - at least you get your own bathroom. The room was clean if rather scruffy and cramped. The service was fine from the various people at reception. We didn't have any problem at all. Besides you are staying in the best area of Rome for a fraction of the price you would normally pay. One more thing... don't be too surprised if the toilet flushing mechanism, is somewhat eccentric! Don't expect much and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Be afraid, be very afraid!”
Reviews.Author: RowlandMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! The toilet seat broke, the curtains fell down when I pulled them across and the bed sheets were filthy! We were given another room but the air-conditioning did'nt work and the 'phone was dead. In the end we went to another hotel, despite having paid 6 nights in advanace. This place was so bad that it was allmost funny! Basil Faulty eat your heart out! Australian Visitor to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Mickey24
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marcus Hotel was terrible!! The location was very good but we dreaded going back to our hotel room. There was an unbearable smell that would come form the drain pipes in the bathroom. We old management about it and they didnt care...they just said its common in souch old buildings. The shower was too small and you can hardly move (i am a thin person) The overall cleanliness of the hotel was not good!! Very dissapointing for the price we paid. i would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Beaurex212
Reviews.Content: The hotel was sold to us based on price and location, but Rome is small enough that no matter where you stay you're within a short taxi, metro or walk away from the major sites. The front desk at the Marcus, which has a frighteningly small elevator, is useless and gruff. Yes, they serve breakfast in the morning but who the hell cares. The rooms are tiny, there are dangerous, poorly lit stairs to get both into the hotel as well as your room. AC in our room did not work; had to leave window open. Shower had mold all over the curtains and the water spilled into room -- the bathroom is the size of a garment bag. Thankfully we only had to stay in the room for one night -- that said, you can do just as well for price anywhere else. This place was uglier than hostels I've stayed in and paid way less for.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: Jimcam
Reviews.Content: After paying in full for 5 nights at the Marcus we arrived late at night to be shown to a room with gaping holes in the ceiling no wardrobe or drawers to put your clothes and a complete lack of care. We refused the room and had another 3 rooms within 2 days. the bed sheets had been repaired so many times they looked like lace in parts, in one of the rooms there was a smell like an open sewer. If I could have I would found somewhere else put had payed up front. I can think of no good points for the hotel and would avoid it if you can

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING PLACE”
Reviews.Author: stayc21
Reviews.Content: Hotel Marcus was absolutely disgusting. After looking at the website and through the pictures I got the impression that it was much nicer and more accomodating than it was. The website made the double room look MUCH bigger than it really was. The manager was extremely rude, our room was unbearably cold, the room had a vile smell, there was absolutely no walking space in a double room. no phones in the room...It was quite possibly one of the worst hotels I have stayed at and I have been traveling all over Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Spiderman Bedsheets!”
Reviews.Author: Gary1726
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here from 15th-17th June 06, for a city break in beautiful Rome. Upon checking in to the hotel Marcus, I know that we had made a wrong decision as all of the public areas looked very tired and the assistant did'nt speek a word of English (I know i'm in their country) and so the whole checking-in proceedure was a bit of a mission. Anyway when we we're shown our room I was in for a shock. Greeting us from just inside the door was a hideious, multicoloured Spiderman Duvet set! After a few moments of head shaking and a few words of broken Italian, I decided to continue to check out the room. Upon futher inspection of the room I discovered that the toilet was'nt fasterned to the floor, and was free to move about to its hearts content uncovering a gaping hole in the floor. It was now the assistants turn to shake his head and mutter some words in Italian, and we we're moved to the next door room. This room was was still very tired and a bit shabby, but the toilet worked and there was no sign of Spiderman anywhere. I know this is a negitive review, and I probably personally would'nt stay there again, however I feel that for people looking for a cheap place to crash, who dont mind about shabby interiors or strange choices of bedlinen, but want a hotel in a fantastic location, then this hotel is pretty much perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay again”
Reviews.Author: langner
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for luxury, don't stay here. If you want to watch TV on your vacation and spend the evenings in your hotel, don't book a room in Hotel Marcus. If you want a nice bar and first-class room service, don't stay here. However, if you want a relatively cheap place close to everything, where you can get a good night's sleep, this is perfect. Maybe something changed, but from what we saw there are no serious problems with this hotel. True, the rooms are small, you have to wait a few minutes for hot water, the towels are thin, the TV is small, the people working here don't smile every time you look at them... so what? The hotel is within 5 minutes walking distance from via Condotti and the Spanish Steps, 15 minutes from Vatican City. The value/price ratio is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great ”
Reviews.Author: rmcl26
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, but most rooms throughout Europe are. So that was somewhat expected. However, the bathroom was horible, and small. The toilet was not connected to anything! Not connected to the floor, or the wall behind it, nor was the toilet seat connected to the toilet. Using the bathroom was difficult, and a balancing act. Still, worst of all was the smell. It smelled horibly like sulfer water, and it never got better. The smell just spread throughout our room. The only positive was the location. The hotel is central to everthing, and we walked everywhere. There was never a need for using the metro, busses, or cabs. The hotel is actually in a rather nice and what seemed to be wealthy area, but the hotel just doesn't fit in. Find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Impolite Staff”
Reviews.Author: roxy2travel
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is in a good location, but myself and 5 other friends who stayed here also agreed the staff were quite unfriendly. This made our stay unpleasant. Even though we tried to converse in the little Italian we knew, to make an effort it did not seem to make any difference to the reactions we received when asking simple questions. Just a smile would have been great. On the other hand, the room was generally ok, hot water took a while to heat up. Fortunately there was an air-con unit too. It looks as though the hotel is going under some renovation, and i've seen from other reviews this has been on going for a while. There were wires exposed from plugs/light switches/holes in the bathroom. Some of the rooms smelt awful and we discovered that the bedroom keys opened all the rooms!!! this was quite disconcerning. Although the beds were fairly comfortable, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely not recommend the Marcus”
Reviews.Author: sehaddon
Reviews.Content: We'd give this place 1.5 stars. We stayed here on May 24, 2006, and found many of the same problems already listed here. On their own, the problems are all minor, but it was disappointing to find so many of them in a hotel with such a high price (165 euros a night). The hotel is very well located however, near the Spanish Steps and the metro station - we felt we were paying for the location and nothing more. Overall the impression is of a poorly maintained and unprofessional hotel. Upon our arrival, the buzzer at the gate downstairs for the hotel was missing, so it took a few minutes to figure out how else to get in. Once there, we were taken down the same dilapidated, low-ceilinged, makeshift staircase that seems to have been a fixture there for some time. The room itself was tiny, which would have been fine if that was the only problem. Holes in the plaster showed exposed wires and pipes in the ceiling, and the covers to at least 2 light switches were missing, showing the exposed wires behind them. One of the bedside lights was without a lightbulb (the room was already quite dimly lit). While we were accustomed to the thin towels (we found the same ones in other places we stayed in Italy), we were suprised not to find at least a bathmat in the tiny bathroom. As a result the floor got quite slippery. The shower doors were extremely stubborn to close and open, seemingly not quite in their tracks, and the showerhead would not stay fixed in the holder while taking a shower. The toilet seat also did not appear to be firmly attached to the toilet. We felt that the staff were pressuring us to take their arranged taxi upon our arrival at the hotel and departure to the airport, and when we said we would find our own early-morning transportation to the train station and then the airport, the desk concierge was surly, unhelpful and rude about it. Once we had checked out and were downstairs, we found the locked gate at street level would not open, necessitating a run back up the many flights of stairs to ask the concierge to unlock it from his end. Though we only spent a few hours sleeping there, this was the last night of our trip and was definitely not how we had hoped to end what had been a lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “who comes to rome to sleep?”
Reviews.Author: London_UKJenny
Reviews.Content: The location is certainly perfect. The street life was quiet, mercifully. The beds were comfortable, and at least we had our own bathroom. Breakfasts were adequate (if a little sweet) we were able to stash sweet rolls in our pockets for later inthe day. However, the rooms were tiny; the shower flooded easily, the carpets got wet and smelled (but not as bad as the cat's-pee smell in the hall way and a couple of the other bedrooms the men inour group told us about). With one exception, the staff were generally surly and gave the impression that our presence was an annoyance to them--if we asked for extra towels (which were very thin--like using bedsheets) or a cup of coffee slightly early, they would sort of throw their hands up and say, "Well, o-KAY, if you really must have it". They couldn't quite say no, but they didn't like it. It's true we were a big group, with a few people coming and going over the course of the week, but the final bills were confused and unhelpfully divided. However, Rome being Rome, in the end the hotel doesn't matter. It was just a little annoying, and surprisingly expensive to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly reasonable for a two star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: normiuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in two different rooms – triple (No16 at €58 pppn) and quadruple (No15 at €50 pppn). GOOD POINTS. Area was central, yet quiet. Location was fantastic, couldn’t wish for a better one. Everything was walking distance. Staff were friendly, no problems. You also get a free map of Rome from the reception. Bathrooms were small (shower cubicles only), still of reasonable size to serve their purpose. Rooms were cleaned daily. Italian breakfast was served with an excellent coffee. BAD POINTS. The rooms were extremely small. In the triple room the beds were so closely together that if I wanted to extend my arm I had to make sure that it wouldn’t fall on the face of a person sleeping next to me. There were holes in the ceiling and wires, held together with insulation tape, were hanging out of the wall. This hotel lives up to its two star expectations, no better but no worse. It seems that each room is of a slightly different standard and it is just a matter of luck which one you’ll get.

Reviews.Title: “Did we get the best room or something?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read terrible things about the Hotel Marcus on the Internet, my mother and I felt nervous throughout our flight to Rome, and had even started making plans about booking another hotel if the Marcus turned out to be as terrible as we'd heard. First impressions confirmed our suspicions - the hotel is on the second floor of a slightly delapidated building and the gates can only be opened from the inside. However, once inside our room (room twelve), I almost wept with relief. The bed was big and comfortable, and I liked the high ceiling. The shower took a while to heat up but was fine once it got going, and the toilet worked fine. There was a small balcony with a view onto a courtyard - not especially attractive, but it couldn't have been anywhere but Rome. The towels were thin - but we'd brought our own, and on the last day the staff replaced them with some thicker ones anyway. The bedroom lighting was quite dim, there was exposed wiring on the ceiling and imperfect tiling in the bathroom, which wasn't soundproofed at all, there was no air-con... but for all that we felt cosy in our room which was right at the heart of Rome - the location, down the road from the Spanish Steps, is the best thing about this hotel. Staff were friendly, and coffee at breakfast *was* hot - there was a member of staff making it for us right there. As for the guest whose key was snatched off him on the way out, this seems to be policy at the Marcus: you give your key in when you leave, and when you come back you ring the bell downstairs and they let you in, giving you your key. I'm not sure whether this is common Italian practice but there was always someone on the desk when we came back so the system worked fine. Basically, the Hotel Marcus is a (comparatively) cheap hotel in an outstanding location, where the staff are friendly if you're polite to them. I'd stay there again, provided the room I got next time was no worse than the one I stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Marcus in July 2005 and we were quite disgusted by the place! Fawlty Towers is a good description although I would much rather deal with Basil Fawlty rather than the rude staff at Hotel Marcus! They were very unfriendly and very rude. If we dared to ask for clean towels, toilet paper or the air conditioning remote they would get very angry about this! I do not think it acceptable to have the same towels (only one each) for a whole week!! Our window was tiny because of the bathroom blocking it, and outside the window was not a view, but a big old boiler covering it!! The bed had blood stains on it, and there were wires hanging out of holes in the walls, and faulty sockets. One one occasion a member of staff snatched our room keys off us when we were going out in the evening! Naturally, I snatched them back and he shouted at me very aggressively and literally pushed me out the door! Shocking!! I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, and would certainly not give a two star rating as it was absolutely filthy! Obviously I cannot comment on all other rooms in the hotel, but we did have to request to change rooms on arrival. Believe it or not - the first room we had was even worse than the one I have described in this review!

Reviews.Title: “Wow ... you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Dmanfromvan
Reviews.Content: So many poor reviews of the Marcus. All I can say is my experience there has been positive. So much so that Ive stayed there twice. Once in 1998 and again in 2002. I think you basically get what you pay for. Location was awesome. We were able to walk to alot of the attractions/sites. They were longish walks but this is how we like to travel. I didnt consider my stay "roughing it" but of course youre not going to get the amenities you find in a North American hotel. Afterall, this is Rome, you should be out having a blast not in your hotel enjoying the bidet. Perhaps my perceptions/expectations will change with old age. Im 6'2 and could barely squeeze into the shower and yes, the water did get cold quick. But a vacation is what you make of it especially if you choose a budget place like this. No problem with any of the staff at all. I believe this is a family run operation (or at least it was at one time). In 1998, the young guy at the front desk had a long ponytail. In 2002, the same guy was there only with shorter hair ... and unbelievably he remembered me and the names and stories of the different group of people I travelled with in 1998. If you ingratiate yourself to people, they will go beyond being your "hotel staff" and become your "friend". Thats what travel is all about.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Marcus
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Clementino 94, 00186 Rome, Italy
